DOC.brief_summary: The objective study : 1 . To show reduction late thrombosis ( LT ) rate follow percutaneous revascularization use current interventional technique new stent placement intravascular radiation therapy ( IRT ) long-term antiplatelet regimen ( 12 month ) compare stented patient short-term antiplatelet regimen ( 2 month ) IRT arm GAMMA I Trial . 2 . To show equivalence LT rate follow percutaneous revascularization use current interventional technique without new stent placement IRT long-term antiplatelet regimen ( 6 month ) compare non-stented patient short term antiplatelet therapy ( 2 month less ) pool IRT arm GAMMA I , SCRIPPS , WRIST Trials .
DOC.brief_title: A Multicenter Trial Localized Radiation Therapy Inhibit Restenosis ( GAMMA V )
DOC.criteria: 1 . The patient restenosis > 60 % ( subjective angiographic determination minimal luminal diameter compare distal reference diameter ) within native coronary artery previously undergone stent placement . 2 . The patient history , sign , laboratory study suggest coronary ischemia attributable target stenosis . 3 . The study target lesion must locate restenotic native coronary artery measure > 2.75 < 4.0 mm diameter 45 mm length . The target lesion must undergo coronary interventional treatment > 4 week previously . 4 . The vessel 1 cm distal target lesion > 2.5 mm diameter . 5 Patients age must > 18 year < 85 year . 1 . Attempts treat lesion vessel procedure unsuccessful . 2 . The patient sustain recent ( < 72 hour ) myocardial infarction define serum CK 2x upper limit normal elevate MB . 3 . Serum creatinine > 2.0 mg/dl . 4 . The left ventricular ejection fraction < 40 % .
